name: Big Data Tools
description:
With this plugin, you can conveniently work with Zeppelin notebooks, run applications with spark-submit, produce and consume messages with Kafka, monitor Spark and Hadoop YARN applications, and work with following file storages:

  • AWS S3
  • DigitalOcean Spaces
  • Google Cloud Storage
  • Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS)
  • Linode
  • Microsoft Azure
  • Minio
  • SFTP
  • Yandex Object Storage

You can use this plugin in IntelliJ-based IDEs including IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate, PyCharm Professional, DataGrip and DataSpell.


For Zeppelin notebooks with Scala and Python code, the plugin offers smart navigation, code completion, inspections, quick-fixes, and refactorings. You can browse, create, and run Zeppelin notebooks without leaving the IDE. If your Zeppelin server uses a Spark cluster, or you have configured a Spark cluster in the plugin settings, the plugin allows you to track Spark jobs, preview cluster environment and storage information from the IDE. With ZTools, you can view details of the variables as you execute your notebooks and enable smart completion for data frame columns in SQL, Scala ans Python.


You can also upload, download, and preview large structured files in tabular form, including CSV, Parquet, AVRO, and ORC formats.
notes:
Changes in 1.3

Features

New convenient notebook UI

  • Outputs now have classical vertical layout
  • New floating toolbars for adding paragraphs and toolbars with all relevant actions
  • Paragraph titles got new UI and they can be renamed right in the editor
  • More useful actions for the toolbar and popup menu in editor, and the gutter popup menu
  • New split mode in table and chart outputs to show table and chart simultaneously
  • Rarely used Zeppelin note actions are grouped under the “More” button
  • Reworked pagination UI in tables; an option to enable line wrapping in text outputs

Zeppelin notes

  • Improved logiс for working with remote notes that ensures better stability
  • Vertical line on a paragraph left side indicates synchronization with the Zeppelin server
  • New paragraph actions `Move` and `Clone`
  • Ability to save code of a Zeppelin note as an .html file
  • Note view settings are added under the Big Data Tools Connections section
    • Ability to set confirmation for paragraph deletion in notes
    • Line wrapping control
    • Folding
    • Line numbering
  • Improved rendering of HTML on HDPI monitors
  • Ability to open table output in a separate editor tab
  • DDL can be shown for note output tables in both SQL and JSON formats

BDT Panel

  • Ability to delete several connections in the BDT tool window
  • Export and import actions for Zeppelin notes are called now Save to Disk and Upload from Disk actions
  • Shortcut to open the BDT Panel:
    • MacOS - Ctrl+Shift+Cmd+B
    • Windows, Linux - Ctrl+Alt+Shift+B

Connection Settings

  • Support SSH connection for S3

Bug Fixes

Zeppelin notes

  • Python: Fixed button `Install package` on MacOS
  • Notes can be opened from any File Storage server as notes, not as .json files
  • The problem with notification on the interpreter restart status is fixed
  • Shift+Shift (Search Everywhere) action is fixed
  • Fixed table specific bugs
    • Filter search works much better
    • Improved pagination support
    • Improved floating point values visualization
    • Problems with searching results are resolved

Remote File System

  • Orc, avro, and parquet files without extension now are reopened correctly on the IDE startup
  • Several problems with opening parquet files are fixed
  • The problem with showing the same content for two different parquet files with identical names is resolved
  • Added notifications on opening files from the Local Driver and remote File Storages in read-only mode
  • Exception on showing file info on parquet via SSH is fixed

BDT Panel

  • BDT tool window buttons behave correctly when there are no connections

Connection Settings

  • GCS support for public buckets is improved - more convenient error messages
  • Improved validation for file storage connections
  • Clear error messages in case of some errors in settings

Spark and Hadoop Monitoring

  • Spark and Hadoop monitoring filters apply without refreshing the corresponding connection in the BDT tool window

Minor changes

Zeppelin Notes

  • Hint for `Go to Paragraph` action is added
  • Fix the Run button in the gutter

Changes in 1.2.3

Features

  • Zeppelin 0.10 now supported
  • Added ‘named profile’ authentication type for AWS S3
  • Python code highlighting now available in DataGrip

Bug Fixes

  • Improved resolution in Zeppelin notebooks with default markers if no interpreter settings are available
  • Fixed problems with Python code completion after reopening projects and restarting the IDE
  • Improved checking for ZTools library versions and instructions for manual installation of ZTools
  • Fixed ZTools execution errors if there are problems with catalogs
  • Spark projects with Gradle are now created properly
  • Fixed problems with formatting and code assistance for Spark and PySpark in Zeppelin notebooks

Changes in 1.2.2

Features

  • File Structure now works for Python cells

Bug Fixes

  • Improved the display of Spark Monitoring in the case of null values for various timestamps
  • Fixed the error on calling the popup menu in some UI components of the Spark Submit dialogue
  • The hotkey for Go To Paragraph no longer overlaps with one for the IntelliJ Platform
  • Made the file structure for our notes compatible with the latest version of Scala
  • Fixed the exception that occurred when selecting nodes in the file structure for Zeppelin Note

Changes in 1.2.1

Bug Fixes

  • Fixed the IDE freeze that was caused by the BDT panel being refreshed incorrectly
  • External links in Python code completion are now resolved properly after you restart the IDE

Changes in 1.2

Bug Fixes

  • Improved support for symlinked files and folders
  • Fixed exceptions when working with files in the BDT panel
  • In Scala code, strings will no longer be underlined
  • Fixed the Ztools 404 error on running cells
  • Improved the filter for Spark-monitoring applications
  • Fixed problems with opening .parquet, .avro, and .orc files
  • Improved Spark Job extraction
  • Fixed an exception during Python completion
  • Improved charts and their settings
  • Autoimport quick-fix in Zeppelin notes now works as intended
  • Improved the display of Spark Job links in Zeppelin notes
  • Added HTTP redirection support for Spark, Hadoop, and Zeppelin
  • Fixed a rare exception in the BDT panel on IDE startup
  • Better resolve of dependencies for Zeppelin connections
  • Fixed a name collision with notes and folders of the same name in Zeppelin connections
  • Improved the refreshing of the BDT panel if it contains an HDFS connection
  • Fixed a file chooser error when dumping remote tabular files
  • Reworked BDT Connection settings
  • Improved the validation of BDT Connection settings
  • Fixed issues for resolve parameters in Spark Submit
  • Resolved precode variables in local Zeppelin notes
  • Fixed a problem with the display of Kafka connections

Minor Changes

  • Cosmetic fixes in BDT settings
  • Focus will not jump to the end of a Zeppelin note after you reopen it

The full release notes are available here.
